page.title: 09OAKENCLOUGH:ECOLOGY MATTERS
page.content: Ecology is of primary importance in this part of the country.The area has been termed"an oasis in the hills."As an oasis refers to a source of drinking water this is an apt anology,for one of the largest landowners is the North West Water Authority.There are three reservoirs which together help to keep the water taps of Blackpool running.Notices draw attention to the fact that the area is a water collecting ground:"THIS YOUR DRINKING WATER:PLEASE DON'T POLLUTE." "NO ADMITTANCE."These strictures apply to the land immediatly to the west of the minor north south road.The moorland country to the east of the road is conserved as a grouse shooting area, there being at least four rather peremptroy notices:"PRIVATE LAND:KEEP OFF."The numerous sheep disregard it.
